faqs.q: Where does the TechLabs take place?
faqs.a: We run in multiple cities and online. Check the application page for your city.

faqs.q: Is it a full time program?
faqs.a: No. It is designed to fit alongside work or studies (part-time).
We look for motivation and potential, not prior experience. You need to be 18+, have basic computer skills, and be able to commit 15-20 hours per week to learning.

faqs.q: How long does the program take?
faqs.a: The complete program takes 20 weeks, divided into 4 phases: Application (2 weeks), Foundation Learning (8 weeks), Project Development (6 weeks), and Career Launch (4 weeks).
We currently offer 4 tracks: Web Development, Data Science, Product Design, and Artificial Intelligence. Each track is designed to prepare you for entry-level positions in that field.
While we don't guarantee job placement, we provide extensive career support including portfolio building, networking events, job application guidance, and connections to our partner companies.

faqs.q: What if I can't attend in-person sessions?
faqs.a: Our program is designed as blended learning, meaning most content is available online. In-person sessions are optional but highly recommended for networking and community building.
No hidden costs. The program is completely free, including all learning materials, mentorship, and career support. You only need to provide your own computer and internet connection.

faqs.q: Can I switch tracks during the program?
faqs.a: Track switching is possible during the first 2 weeks of the Foundation Learning phase, subject to availability and mentor approval. We encourage you to choose carefully based on your interests and career goals.
Graduates become part of our alumni network with access to continued learning resources, networking events, and career opportunities. Many stay involved as mentors or volunteers.
Our mentors are experienced professionals from partner companies and our alumni network. They undergo training in effective teaching methods and are committed to supporting student success.

faqs.q: What makes TechLabs different from other coding bootcamps?
faqs.a: Our unique blend of free education, local community support, and focus on practical skills sets us apart. We prioritize accessibility and long-term career success over quick technical training.
